all_questions.question: Will training a neural machine translation system on short sentences result in lower BLEU scores?
all_questions.context: If you train on short sentences only then the BLEU score will be very low

all_questions.question: What is the average number of output words when training on a full range of sentence lengths using the parent model?
all_questions.context: If you train on everything and the performance was the best possible on this corpus, then the average number of output words would be 15

all_questions.question: How does training on sentences with 20 to 40 words affect the BLEU score compared to the baseline?
all_questions.context: If you train on sentences with 20 to 40 words, then the BLEU score is actually also low, much lower than the baseline

all_questions.question: Why are long outputs penalized in the brevity penalty?
all_questions.context: With two long outputs, the system is penalized on the precision of n-grams

all_questions.question: What is the effect of different parents on the output length of the neural machine translation system?
all_questions.context: These parents know only how to produce sentences of certain length and they tend to be too short or too long depending on which parent it was
